text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies! Today I have a special

Ro: guest, Greg! Greg: Hey guys! Ro: He’s
a special effects artist from

Ro: Barnyard FX, and today we are gonna be
making a birthday cake for…

Greg: For Red 5, my art director at Barnyard
FX.

Ro: She is really cool, and she loves Star
Wars! Greg: Star Wars and cake,

Greg: 2 things everybody loves. Ro: Star Wars…
Greg: Cake! The Deathstar.
Ro: Look at that Deathstar! Pooooooghhhh!
Ro: Let’s get started!

Ro: The things that we used to make this cake
were: this is a 9x13 pan, and it’s a

Ro: little bit deeper than most cake pans,
because it’s about 2 inches deep,

Ro: because we’re gonna make a lot of cake.
We’re gonna make a big trench.
Greg: It’s a big party.

Ro: Yeah, it’s gonna be a big party, it’s
gonna be pretty cool!

Ro: So I’m gonna put this down, but I’ve
already pre-made the cake, and we made,

Ro: we thought it’d be really cool, Greg
had the idea to make it red velvet cake,

Ro: because… Greg; Red 5, it’s her favorite.
Ro: Because, it’s so cool, it’s

Ro: so creative. So what we did
is we made 2 of these cakes, I’m only
Ro: showing 1 right now because we didn't have enough room on the table, but this is

Ro: 1 of ‘em. And the other things you’ll
need will be:

Greg: We need a spatula… Ro: Mmmhmmm, Greg:
A cake leveler to flatten it out,
Greg: And a giant bowl of cream cheese icing.

Ro: So the first thing that we’re gonna
do is level our cakes. So the first thing

Ro: that I did is I leveled the top layer,
just to make it really flat.

Ro: And then, I’m setting this on the lowest
setting, and you’re just gonna

Ro: level the cake, make a cut all the way
through, so it cuts the cake in 1/2.

Ro: Now the second thing that we’re gonna
do is we’re gonna cut our cake 6 inches,
Ro: Go in 6 inches!
Greg: 6 inches of cake…

Greg: So hopefully I will leave with as many
fingers as I came with!
Ro: I hope you do too!

Ro: Ta-da! So that’s what you want to do
and now we are gonna do this to
Ro: our 2nd cake.

Ro: We just got our first 2 pieces done, it’s
already starting to look like a

Ro: trench. And now, we already did cake,
cake, and now we’re gonna do icing, icing.

Ro: What you’re gonna do is I put a lot
of cream cheese frosting, because

Ro: it goes really good with red velvet cake,
into this plastic bag, and I’m

Ro: just gonna pipe it down, and Greg is gonna
smooth it out!

Greg: Can I go like, bzzzrch, bzzzrch when
I’m doing it?

Ro: I think you’ll probably frost better
if you make those noises!

Ro: Now we’ve got our 2 cakes assembled,
and we are going to frost the entire thing!

Ro: But we’re gonna use a really thin layer
this time, not as thick as we did with

Ro: the middle layer, we’re just gonna do
a really thin coat all the way around

Ro: because we’re gonna put fondant on the
top of it!
Ro: Peschewm! Chewm! Chewm! High five! Ting!

Greg: So the next step is to roll out the
fondant! Ro: Yep, and Greg, ahhhhh!

Ro: A-ha-ha Greg, the ball of fondant, he
made it look like the Death Star!

Greg: Should we just leave it at that and
call it quits? Ro: Yeah. Done.
Greg: Happy Birthday! Ro: Happy birthday Red!
Ro: Here’s your cake ball of fondant.

Ro: OK, so since it’s really sticky, because
it’s really warm, what you’re gonna

Ro: want to do is, on top of wax paper, you’re
gonna sprinkle a little powdered

Ro: sugar, so that it won’t stick to the
table.

Greg: It’s like a scene from Scarface! Ro:
Yeah!

Ro: We just got our gray fondant all rolled out.
Greg did a great job!

Ro: And now we got our cakes out of the fridge,
and we’re gonna roll it up

Ro: onto this big plastic roller, and then
roll it over 1 of the cakes.

Ro: We just rolled out the gray fondant for
the 2nd cake and now

Ro: I’m gonna pass the torch. Greg: Don’t
make me nervous! Ro: OK.

Ro: OK, once you got the fondant onto both
of the cakes, Greg got these awesome

Ro: photos, check ‘em out! Greg: The surface
of the death star looks super, super

Greg: intricate, but what it really was, was
a bunch of little tiles, little squares

Greg: with different designs, that… Ro:
Oh there we go!

Greg: Kinda look like this. So I found this
on the internet, someone had actually

Greg: recreated all of the individual shapes,
so basically what I want to do is
Greg: make these in fondant.

Ro: I’m gonna have Greg show you the steps
of how to make these tiles, because he

Ro: came up with a system of how to do these,
so…

Ro: And he’s gonna be using a lot of different,
these are just little metal cookie cutters,
Ro: so, let’s see…
Ro: Um, should I pick 1? Greg: Pick 1, yeah!
Ro: Oh, OK! Let’s do, this 1! Greg: Nice!

Greg: Well my idea with the fondant was to
do it just like you would do it if you

Greg: were building the actual model pieces
for the death star. So we have these

Greg: different shapes. Ro: OK… Greg: So
we’re gonna cut ‘em out, the measurements

Greg; of the cake work to, uh, 2 inch increments,
so we’ll go with 2 inch squares.

Greg: So then we need a circle, and then, the thing with
the Death Star surface is it has

Greg: a lot of different levels and a lot
of different detail, so you want to

Greg: make, you can make duplicates, but the
more range-y the better it will look.

Greg: And the more height variation the better,
because if you put too many of

Greg: the same layers, when we put it on there,
it’s just gonna all look flat again.

Ro: Yeah, if everyone’s the same size, it’s
boring!
Ro: You want a lot of height variation!

Ro: So this is what 1 of them looks like.
Greg: So that’s 1. Ro: Pretty cool!

Greg: So now we need to make, like… Ro:
A bunch of ‘em! we’ve gotta get to work

Greg: Like 30 more? Ro: Yeah, so we’re gonna
make about 30 of them, just take
Ro: your time, have fun with it.
Ro: We made all of these! Aren’t they awesome? They look so good! Greg designed them, and I helped

Ro: cut out the shapes, and kinda. Greg: I
just copied the pictures!
Ro: Ha-ha-ha, and I just copied him!

Greg: So to make it stick to this fondant,
you can take a brush, and some water…

Greg: And just put a little bit of water on
the surface, and it will help
Greg: bind this to the cake.

Greg: Alright… Ro: Alright! Greg: Now we
just do that like 100 more times!

Ro: Mmmhmm, we’re just gonna cover the whole
cake.

Ro: We just finished putting all the tiles
on the cake, Greg did a great job,

Ro: these look amazing! But we’re gonna
go crazy! We’re gonna make this even

Ro: crazier! Greg… Greg: But wait, there’s
more!

Ro: Do you want to show them what you made?
Greg: Yeah, well, you know because

Greg: this is the Death Star, and everyone
knows the scene and where, everythings

Greg: flying around and there’s the turrets
with the cannons on them, you can’t

Greg; have the surface of the Death Star without…
The laser turrets!
Ro: They’re so cool! Those are awesome!

Greg: I want to eat it, which is weird, but,
um,

Greg: I never made a model I wanted to eat
before!

Greg: But I took a, a wafer cookie, that was
like, the right length, and um because

Greg: the fondant, like kind of, when you’re working with
it and it’s soft it keeps

Greg: falling over, I wanted something edible
that I could stick in there, so we

Greg: put a wafer cookie and then I just
kept pushing the fondant around it

Greg: and then used some of those little dental
tools to make some shape.

Greg: And then I stuck 2 pieces of pretzel,
like little pretzel sticks. Stuck those

Greg: in there and wrapped some fondant around
it and made little guns.

Greg: And that will go here. Then I made another
1. Ro: He even got crazier!

Greg: That’s even crazier. Ro: Look, ah!
It’s shooting!

Greg: There’s no point in having laser turrets
if there’s no lasers coming out!

Greg: Um, so… Ro: Pew-pew-pew-pew! Greg:
I made that. Ro: That’s amazing!

Ro: The last detail of the cake, Greg made
this, it is amazing!

Ro: This yummy, edible… I can’t even,
OK Greg’s gonna have to tell you about it

Ro: because, it is the coolest thing I have
ever seen!

Greg: it’s uh, probably the tastiest model
I have ever made! Ro: So cool!

Greg: Um, but this is Luke Skywalker, who
is Red 5, um, going through the trench

Greg: with Darth Vader chasing him, with his
very specific uh, angled wing

Greg: tie fighter. So the x wing is, the body
is made out of fondant, which is on,

Greg: um, a piece of wire, the wings are made
out of graham crackers.

Greg: These are obviously pretzel sticks,
because I wanted something like, long

Greg: and thin, and edible. The thrusters
are also pretzel sticks that I wrapped in

Greg: fondant. Ro: Yum-yum-yum! Greg:
And then the engines and the intakes

Greg: are, uh, Good and Plenty. Ro: Little
candies! Greg: Yeah! And they were

Greg: the exact um, size that I needed and
they were also white. But then all the
Greg: details I used these, uh, edible markers.

Ro: And then you also have the lasers shooting
out, oh my gosh!

Greg: And then the actual, like, cockpit areas
is 1 of your gumballs.

Ro: That’s right! He used a gum ball from
Nerdy Nummies right back here!
Greg: Right off the set!

Ro: This looks amazing! Greg: And that’s
Darth Vader and Red 5!

Ro: I’m so excited! We’re finally gonna
put the last piece in.

Ro: Greg’s doing the honors because
he did such a good job and I’m

Ro: so excited! Greg: Oh sure, leave it to…
Ro: Yeah!
Greg: What if I mess it up?
Ro: Let me stand back…

Ro: Pew-pew! Pew-pew! I’ll do the sound
effects!
Ro: Pew-pew! Pew-pew!
Ro: Oh my gosh it’s so cool!

Ro: Ta-da! We just finished the cake, this
amazing cake! Thanks to Greg!

Ro: Most detailed cake ever probably done
on Nerdy Nummies! It’s so cool!

Greg: Well thank you! I still have a lot to
learn, but with you as my personal

Greg; cake Yoda, I think, uh, I can master
the art.
Ro: Teach you baking I will!

Ro: Alright, I’m gonna put all of Greg’s
links down below, we started him on

Ro: YouTube, so we got him a YouTube channel,
and there’s a ton of behind the scenes

Ro: videos that are there right now because
in addition to working on Hollywood

Ro: films, he also works on a lot of new media
projects that you would probably

Ro: recognize. Like The Guild, or Dragaonage,
or tons of bazillion other things.
Greg: There’s a few! They’re all…

Ro: Yeah, there’s a few, so I’ll put his
links down below, Facebook, Twitter and

Ro: YouTube so go check him out! He’s super
cool and super talented!
Greg: Well thank you! Ro: As you can see!

Ro: Alright, thanks you guys, if you have
any suggestions for any other

Ro: Nerdy Nummies, please let me know, leave
me a comment down below and I will
Ro: do my best to make it happen!
Ro: OK, bye you guys, bye-bye!

Greg: Can I get 1 of those gum balls? Ro:
Yeah. Greg: Thanks.

Ro: You can have a couple of them. I think
he earned ‘em right? Agh!

Ro: And the most important part of today is
3, 2, 1!
Both: Happy Birthday Red 5!

Greg: Imagine if Darth Vader actually had to 
build the Death Star out of Cake?
Ro A-ha-ha-ha, he would have been so fat!

Greg: The galaxy would have been a happier
place though.

Ro: He would have been breathing even harder…
He would have been like,
Ro: Hugghhhhh!
